txt.en:
'[placeholder], you brought me out of a pit of pity and despair, and for that I thank you. But while I no longer desire death, I do desire vengeance.

'Do you know what it is like to see your wife and children brutalized and murdered before you, and there is nothing you can do to stop it? I do. The Orcs did just that, and when they were done, I begged for death myself...only the creature which led that band -- an Orc called Matumkâr -- would not allow them to grant me my wish. I was allowed to bury what remained of my children, but my wife I never saw again.

'[placeholder], if naught else comes of this horror, I ask only one thing: see to it that Matumkâr perishes at Thornhope. Let my family have the justice they deserve!'
'You have my gratitude, [placeholder]. The spirits of my children can now have peace....'
'Ha! More fodder for the lads! Come to squeal like the others?'
Wadel, the grieving father you rescued from the ruins of Thornhope, desires nothing but revenge against the monsters who murdered his family.
Matumkâr will likely be found near Wadel's home in Thornhope.\n\nWadel has asked you to kill Matumkâr, the Orc who led the band that murdererd his family.
Wadel is encamped outside the walls of Thornhope.\n\nYou should return to Wadel with news of your victory over Matumkâr.
